{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Associate",
  "description": "Pulse is Africa&rsquo;s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa&rsquo;s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Human Resources Associate to join Pulse Nigeria.
	In this role, you will play a key part in keeping our HR operations running smoothly, supporting recruitment, onboarding, performance management and employee engagement.
	You will work closely with the HR Manager to implement policies and initiatives that strengthen our culture, boost our employer brand and drive business growth.
	The ideal candidate is organised, collaborative and passionate about people. If you are eager to grow your HR career, love creating positive workplace experiences and thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment, this is the role for you.


Responsibilities
Implementation of HR Initiatives:


	Support the HR Manager in rolling out key HR initiatives, including policies, programs and processes that align with Pulse&rsquo;s mission, vision, values and overall business objectives.
	Assist in ensuring these initiatives are effectively communicated and implemented across the organisation.


HR Support &amp; Problem-Solving:


	Assist in gathering relevant information and conducting initial assessments of HR-related challenges.
	Provide timely and accurate support in offering objective advice, guidance and recommendations to managers under the supervision of the HR Manager.


HR Metrics &amp; Reporting:


	Manage the process of tracking, compiling and reporting on HR metrics to aid informed decision-making as well as preparing surveys.


Employee Life Cycle Management:


	Assist in managing the employee life cycle from onboarding to offboarding.
	Support compliance with Nigerian employment laws and international best practices while ensuring a smooth and positive experience for employees at all stages.


Workforce Planning &amp; Talent Acquisition:


	Work closely with the HR Manager to support workforce planning activities.
	Manage the recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, reviewing applications, coordinating selection tests, scheduling interviews, meetings and conducting reference checks
	Ensure a smooth candidate experience by maintaining timely and professional communication throughout the process.


Performance Management Support:


	Coordinate the scheduling of performance reviews and check-in sessions.
	Help gather performance data and feedback to support alignment between employee performance and organisational expectations


Learning &amp; Development Assistance:


	Support employees in accessing learning and development resources.
	Assist in organising internal training programs and liaising with external training providers as needed.
	Provide general support for coaching and employee growth initiatives.


Employee Records &amp; Compliance:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee files, payroll records, and organisational charts.
	Assist in ensuring expatriate documentation and all HR compliance requirements are met.


Confidentiality &amp; Professional Conduct:


	Handle all employee and company information with the highest level of confidentiality and integrity, ensuring disclosure only when authorised and appropriate.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration or a related field.
	2 to 3 years of experience in human resources, recruitment, talent sourcing, HR reporting, a related administrative role, etc.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work effectively across teams.
	Solid organisational skills with a keen eye for details.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with HR management systems (HRIS).
	Ability to manage confidential information with integrity and discretion.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Recruitment &amp; Selection
	Employee Relations
	Organisational Support
	Record keeping
	Performance Management Support
	Communication &amp; Collaboration.


Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Pulse Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188358"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Human Resources Associate Job at Pulse Nigeria




        
    

        
        Pulse is Africa’s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Associate

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Human Resources Associate to join Pulse Nigeria.
	In this role, you will play a key part in keeping our HR operations running smoothly, supporting recruitment, onboarding, performance management and employee engagement.
	You will work closely with the HR Manager to implement policies and initiatives that strengthen our culture, boost our employer brand and drive business growth.
	The ideal candidate is organised, collaborative and passionate about people. If you are eager to grow your HR career, love creating positive workplace experiences and thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment, this is the role for you.


Responsibilities
Implementation of HR Initiatives:


	Support the HR Manager in rolling out key HR initiatives, including policies, programs and processes that align with Pulse’s mission, vision, values and overall business objectives.
	Assist in ensuring these initiatives are effectively communicated and implemented across the organisation.


HR Support & Problem-Solving:


	Assist in gathering relevant information and conducting initial assessments of HR-related challenges.
	Provide timely and accurate support in offering objective advice, guidance and recommendations to managers under the supervision of the HR Manager.


HR Metrics & Reporting:


	Manage the process of tracking, compiling and reporting on HR metrics to aid informed decision-making as well as preparing surveys.


Employee Life Cycle Management:


	Assist in managing the employee life cycle from onboarding to offboarding.
	Support compliance with Nigerian employment laws and international best practices while ensuring a smooth and positive experience for employees at all stages.


Workforce Planning & Talent Acquisition:


	Work closely with the HR Manager to support workforce planning activities.
	Manage the recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, reviewing applications, coordinating selection tests, scheduling interviews, meetings and conducting reference checks
	Ensure a smooth candidate experience by maintaining timely and professional communication throughout the process.


Performance Management Support:


	Coordinate the scheduling of performance reviews and check-in sessions.
	Help gather performance data and feedback to support alignment between employee performance and organisational expectations


Learning & Development Assistance:


	Support employees in accessing learning and development resources.
	Assist in organising internal training programs and liaising with external training providers as needed.
	Provide general support for coaching and employee growth initiatives.


Employee Records & Compliance:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee files, payroll records, and organisational charts.
	Assist in ensuring expatriate documentation and all HR compliance requirements are met.


Confidentiality & Professional Conduct:


	Handle all employee and company information with the highest level of confidentiality and integrity, ensuring disclosure only when authorised and appropriate.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration or a related field.
	2 to 3 years of experience in human resources, recruitment, talent sourcing, HR reporting, a related administrative role, etc.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work effectively across teams.
	Solid organisational skills with a keen eye for details.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with HR management systems (HRIS).
	Ability to manage confidential information with integrity and discretion.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Recruitment & Selection
	Employee Relations
	Organisational Support
	Record keeping
	Performance Management Support
	Communication & Collaboration.


Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

Job Position: Store Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a Store Officer with a science background and 2&ndash;3 years&rsquo; experience&nbsp;in store or inventory management.
	The ideal candidate must also have knowledge of HACCP standards and be able to ensure proper stock handling, documentation, and compliance with food safety practices.


Requirements


	Science background
	&nbsp;2 &ndash; 3 years of experience in a store/inventory role
	Knowledge of HACCP principles
	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills
	Ability to resume immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;vomokhoa@chocolatroyal.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application - Store Officer&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Store Officer Job at CoolFM / Wazobia FM




        
    

        
        CoolFM / Wazobia FM is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a Store Officer with a science background and 2–3 years’ experience in store or inventory management.
	The ideal candidate must also have knowledge of HACCP standards and be able to ensure proper stock handling, documentation, and compliance with food safety practices.


Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Science background
	 2 – 3 years of experience in a store/inventory role
	Knowledge of HACCP principles
	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills
	Ability to resume immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: vomokhoa@chocolatroyal.com using “Application - Store Officer" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative Assistant",
  "description": "Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria&rsquo;s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Sagamu in Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized and dependable Administrative Assistant with over 4 years of professional experience.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for a wide range of administrative tasks to support our office operations, including managing schedules, handling correspondence, performing office errands, and maintaining efficient office systems.
	The candidate must possess strong multitasking abilities, excellent communication skills, and a valid driver&rsquo;s license, with the ability to drive when necessary.
	This is a full-time salaried position offering a competitive compensation package.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain executive schedules, including appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Handle incoming calls, emails, and correspondence efficiently.
	Organize and maintain office filing systems, both physical and digital.
	Prepare and edit reports, presentations, and other documents as needed.
	Coordinate office errands, including picking up or delivering items, documents, and other administrative tasks.
	Provide support for meetings, including preparation of agendas, taking minutes, and ensuring all meeting logistics are in place.
	Assist in the preparation of office budgets and track expenses.
	Handle general office management tasks such as maintaining office supplies and equipment.
	Ensure compliance with office policies, health and safety regulations, and confidentiality standards.
	Other ad-hoc administrative duties as requested by management.


Qualifications


	Minimum of 4 years of experience as an Administrative Assistant or in a similar role.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Must have a valid driver&rsquo;s license and be comfortable driving as required.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism at all times.


Preferred Qualifications:


	A Diploma or degree in Business Administration or a related field is an advantage.
	Experience in office management or executive assistance is a plus.


Working Conditions:


	Must be able to travel locally when required.
	Competitive salary range based on experience.
	A dynamic and supportive work environment.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 (based on experience).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience to:&nbsp;ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Administrative Assistant Job at Nine Stars Limited




        
    

        
        Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria’s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Sagamu in Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly organized and dependable Administrative Assistant with over 4 years of professional experience.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for a wide range of administrative tasks to support our office operations, including managing schedules, handling correspondence, performing office errands, and maintaining efficient office systems.
	The candidate must possess strong multitasking abilities, excellent communication skills, and a valid driver’s license, with the ability to drive when necessary.
	This is a full-time salaried position offering a competitive compensation package.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain executive schedules, including appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Handle incoming calls, emails, and correspondence efficiently.
	Organize and maintain office filing systems, both physical and digital.
	Prepare and edit reports, presentations, and other documents as needed.
	Coordinate office errands, including picking up or delivering items, documents, and other administrative tasks.
	Provide support for meetings, including preparation of agendas, taking minutes, and ensuring all meeting logistics are in place.
	Assist in the preparation of office budgets and track expenses.
	Handle general office management tasks such as maintaining office supplies and equipment.
	Ensure compliance with office policies, health and safety regulations, and confidentiality standards.
	Other ad-hoc administrative duties as requested by management.


Qualifications


	Minimum of 4 years of experience as an Administrative Assistant or in a similar role.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Must have a valid driver’s license and be comfortable driving as required.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism at all times.


Preferred Qualifications:


	A Diploma or degree in Business Administration or a related field is an advantage.
	Experience in office management or executive assistance is a plus.


Working Conditions:


	Must be able to travel locally when required.
	Competitive salary range based on experience.
	A dynamic and supportive work environment.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 (based on experience).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources (HR) Officer",
  "description": "Nine Stars Agricultural Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria&rsquo;s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented HR Officer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of relevant HR experience and excellent proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, to manage HR processes efficiently and support organizational growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle the end-to-end recruitment process: job postings, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Maintain accurate HR records and personnel files.
	Prepare and process payroll, leave schedules, and attendance reports.
	Use Microsoft Excel to create, analyze, and manage HR data, including staff records, performance metrics, and payroll sheets.
	Assist in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures.
	Coordinate employee training, performance appraisals, and career development initiatives.
	Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries, grievances, and conflict resolution.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as an HR Officer or in a similar HR role.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite&mdash;with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, data analysis) required.
	Good knowledge of HR best practices, labor laws, and payroll processes.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.


Compensation &amp; Benefits


	Competitive salary range of N100,000 - N150,000 based on experience and qualifications.
	Opportunities for career development and professional training.
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter to:&nbsp;ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;HR Officer Application&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",

  },

Human Resources (HR) Officer Job at Nine Stars Agricultural Limited




        
    

        
        Nine Stars Agricultural Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria’s market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Saapade, Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled agricultural and real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Officer

Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented HR Officer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of relevant HR experience and excellent proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, to manage HR processes efficiently and support organizational growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle the end-to-end recruitment process: job postings, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Maintain accurate HR records and personnel files.
	Prepare and process payroll, leave schedules, and attendance reports.
	Use Microsoft Excel to create, analyze, and manage HR data, including staff records, performance metrics, and payroll sheets.
	Assist in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures.
	Coordinate employee training, performance appraisals, and career development initiatives.
	Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries, grievances, and conflict resolution.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as an HR Officer or in a similar HR role.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite—with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, data analysis) required.
	Good knowledge of HR best practices, labor laws, and payroll processes.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.


Compensation & Benefits


	Competitive salary range of N100,000 - N150,000 based on experience and qualifications.
	Opportunities for career development and professional training.
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using “HR Officer Application” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Digital Marketing Executive",
  "description": "DigitalentsHUB Limited is a forward-thinking innovation and talent development company committed to empowering businesses and individuals through digital transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a creative, analytical, and results-driven Digital Marketing Executive to join our dynamic team and drive impactful campaigns that boost our brand visibility, customer acquisition, and engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and manage digital marketing strategies across social media, email, SEO/SEM, and paid ads.
	Plan and execute online campaigns to increase brand awareness, generate leads, and boost sales.
	Manage and grow the company&rsquo;s social media presence with engaging and relevant content.
	Monitor and analyze performance metrics, preparing regular reports to optimize campaign results.
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify new digital trends and opportunities.
	Collaborate with the design, content, and business development teams to deliver integrated campaigns.
	Manage digital marketing budgets effectively and ensure maximum ROI.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field.
	3+ years of proven experience in digital marketing or similar role.
	Strong knowledge of SEO, SEM, Google Analytics, Google Ads, and social media advertising.
	Excellent content creation and copywriting skills.
	Hands-on experience with marketing automation tools and email campaigns.
	Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with Canva, Photoshop, or other design tools.
	Knowledge of video marketing and storytelling.
	Familiarity with influencer and community marketing strategies.
	Creative thinker with a passion for digital innovation.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 - N250,000 Monthly.
	Competitive salary and performance bonuses.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
	A dynamic, innovative, and collaborative work environment.
	Exposure to exciting digital projects with global impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;bimbolaspeaks@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Digital Marketing Executive Job at Digitalents HUB Limited




        
    

        
        DigitalentsHUB Limited is a forward-thinking innovation and talent development company committed to empowering businesses and individuals through digital transformation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Executive
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a creative, analytical, and results-driven Digital Marketing Executive to join our dynamic team and drive impactful campaigns that boost our brand visibility, customer acquisition, and engagement.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop, implement, and manage digital marketing strategies across social media, email, SEO/SEM, and paid ads.
	Plan and execute online campaigns to increase brand awareness, generate leads, and boost sales.
	Manage and grow the company’s social media presence with engaging and relevant content.
	Monitor and analyze performance metrics, preparing regular reports to optimize campaign results.
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify new digital trends and opportunities.
	Collaborate with the design, content, and business development teams to deliver integrated campaigns.
	Manage digital marketing budgets effectively and ensure maximum ROI.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field.
	3+ years of proven experience in digital marketing or similar role.
	Strong knowledge of SEO, SEM, Google Analytics, Google Ads, and social media advertising.
	Excellent content creation and copywriting skills.
	Hands-on experience with marketing automation tools and email campaigns.
	Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with Canva, Photoshop, or other design tools.
	Knowledge of video marketing and storytelling.
	Familiarity with influencer and community marketing strategies.
	Creative thinker with a passion for digital innovation.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 - N250,000 Monthly.
	Competitive salary and performance bonuses.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
	A dynamic, innovative, and collaborative work environment.
	Exposure to exciting digital projects with global impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: bimbolaspeaks@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
